panels.description: The hit rate of block cache
panels.title: Block cache hit

panels.description: Shows average latency for Reads and Writes IO Devices.  Higher than typical latency for highly loaded causet_storage indicates saturation (overload) and is frequent cause of performance problems.  Higher than normal latency also can indicate internal causet_storage problems.
panels.title: Disk Latency

panels.description: Shows amount of physical IOs (reads and writes) different devices are serving. Spikes in number of IOs served often corresponds to performance problems due to IO subsystem overload.
panels.title: Disk Operations

panels.description: Shows volume of reads and writes the causet_storage is handling. This can be better measure of IO capacity usage for network attached and SSD causet_storage as it is often bandwidth limited.  Amount of data being written to the disk can be used to estimate Flash causet_storage life time.
panels.title: Disk Bandwidth

panels.description: Shows how much disk was loaded for reads or writes as average number of outstanding requests at different period of time.  High disk load is a good measure of actual causet_storage utilization. Different causet_storage types handle load differently - some will show latency increases on low loads others can handle higher load with no problems.
panels.title: Disk Load
